unnormalised: Looks like your Diwali plans might need a little tweaking, folks! The price of LPG cylinders saw another jump this week, hitting Rs. 1150 in Delhi. That's gonna sting the wallet, especially with festive feasts like biryani on the menu!
normalised: Looks like your Diwali plans might need a little tweaking, folks! The price of L P G cylinders saw another jump this week, hitting rupee one thousand one hundred and fifty in Delhi. That's gonna sting the wallet, especially with festive feasts like biryani on the menu!

unnormalised: Experts at IIM Ahmedabad are saying global crude oil prices are to blame, but that doesn't make the chappati any easier to swallow, does it?
normalised: Experts at I I M Ahmedabad are saying global crude oil prices are to blame, but that doesn't make the chappati any easier to swallow, does it?

unnormalised: "This is becoming a real problem for middle-class families," says Sunita Sharma, a homemaker from Mumbai. "Last year, we spent nearly Rs. 8000 on gas alone. At this rate, Onam next year will be a simple affair!"
normalised: "This is becoming a real problem for middle-class families," says Sunita Sharma, a homemaker from Mumbai. "Last year, we spent nearly rupee eight thousand on gas alone. At this rate, Onam next year will be a simple affair!"

unnormalised: State-owned oil companies like IOCL are expected to announce new rates on the 1st of next month. Fingers crossed it's not another hike!
normalised: State-owned oil companies like I O C L are expected to announce new rates on the first of next month. Fingers crossed it's not another hike!

unnormalised: Meanwhile, folks are already strategizing. Some are looking at electric alternatives, others are rediscovering the joys of cooking with firewood (carefully, of course!). Even switching to smaller 5 kg cylinders seems to be trending to cut costs for now. Every rupee counts, especially during festival time!
normalised: Meanwhile, folks are already strategizing. Some are looking at electric alternatives, others are rediscovering the joys of cooking with firewood (carefully, of course!). Even switching to smaller five kilogram cylinders seems to be trending to cut costs for now. Every rupee counts, especially during festival time!
